abstract: Common Sense Investment Management, a $2.9 billion fund of funds based in Oregon, sought to distance itself on Wednesday from a prostitution scandal involving its chief executive.
snippet: Common Sense Investment Management, a $2.9 billion fund of funds based in Oregon, sought to distance itself on Wednesday from a prostitution scandal involving its chief executive.
lead_paragraph: Updated, 7:11 p.m. to provide details on the ownership of Common Sense. |

headline.main: Fund Responds to Chief’s Prostitution Arrest
